metadata.title: OData EDM model structure
metadata.description: This document lists all EDM model elements, their attributes and relationships. It [categorizes the attributes](#attribute-categories) in different types (basic, reference, ..) and describes their semantics in detail . It is based on the OASIS OData CSDL XML Representation Version 4.02 specification, and adds the details about allowed values, symbolic references and constraints for elements and attributes.

elements.name: Edmx
elements.description: The root element of a CSDL XML document.

attributes.description: version number string
attributes.name: Version

elements.name: DataServices
elements.description: The edmx:DataServices contains one or more edm:Schema elements.

elements.name: Reference
elements.description: specifies external CSDL documents

attributes.description: URI string
attributes.name: Uri

elements.name: Schema
elements.description: One or more schemas describe the entity model exposed by an OData service. The schema acts as a namespace for elements of the entity model such as entity types, complex types, enumerations and terms.

attributes.description: A simple identifier used to uniquely identify the element within its containing scope.
attributes.name: Namespace

attributes.description: The alias of a schema MAY be used instead of the namespaceto identify model elements of that schema.
attributes.name: Alias

elements.name: Include
elements.description: Specifies a schema to include from the referenced CSDL document.

attributes.description: namespace reference
attributes.name: Namespace

attributes.description: The value that can be used in qualified names instead of the namespace.
attributes.name: Alias

elements.name: IncludeAnnotations
elements.description: Specifies the annotations to include from the referenced CSDL document. Add

attributes.description: namespace reference
attributes.name: TermNamespace

attributes.description: Optional qualifier to distinguish multiple instances
attributes.name: Qualifier

attributes.description: namespace reference
attributes.name: TargetNamespace

elements.name: Action
elements.description: Actions are service-defined operations that may have observable side effects and may return a single instance or a collection of instances of any type.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: The actionâ€™s name.
Whether the action/function is bound to a specific entity type
attributes.name: IsBound

attributes.context: relative to the action's parameters when bound
attributes.description: entity set path expression
attributes.name: EntitySetPath

elements.name: Annotations
elements.description: Used to apply a group of annotations to a single model element.

attributes.description: target path expression
attributes.name: Target

attributes.description: Optional qualifier to distinguish multiple instances
attributes.name: Qualifier

elements.name: ComplexType
elements.description: Complex types are keyless nominal structured types. The lack of a key means that instances of complex types cannot be referenced, created, updated or deleted independently of an entity type. Complex types allow entity models to group properties into common structures.

attributes.description: The name identifier of the element
attributes.name: Name

attributes.description: qualified name of a edm:ComplexType
attributes.name: BaseType

attributes.description: Whether the type is abstract and cannot be instantiated directly
attributes.name: Abstract

attributes.description: Whether the type allows additional properties not explicitly declared
attributes.name: OpenType

elements.name: EntityContainer
elements.description: Entity containers define the entity sets, singletons, function and action imports exposed by the service.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: The EntityContainer's name
qualified entity container name
attributes.name: Extends

elements.name: EntityType
elements.description: An entity type is the template for an entity: any uniquely identifiable record.

attributes.description: The entity typeâ€™s name that MUST be unique within its schema.
attributes.name: Name

attributes.description: qualified name of an edm:EntityType
attributes.name: BaseType

attributes.description: Whether the type is abstract and cannot be instantiated directly
attributes.name: Abstract

attributes.description: Whether the type allows additional properties not explicitly declared
attributes.name: OpenType

attributes.description: Whether the entity type supports media resources
attributes.name: HasStream

elements.name: EnumType
elements.description: Enumeration types are nominal types that represent a non-empty series of related values. Enumeration types expose these related values as members of the enumeration.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: The enumeration typeâ€™s name

attributes.constraints: restricted to: Edm.Byte, Edm.SByte, Edm.Int16, Edm.Int32, or Edm.Int64
attributes.description: qualified name of and integer type
attributes.name: UnderlyingType

attributes.description: Whether the enumeration supports bitwise operations
attributes.name: IsFlags

elements.name: Function
elements.description: Function overloads allow functions to be defined with multiple different parameter sets.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: The function's name.
Whether the action/function is bound to a specific entity type
attributes.name: IsBound

attributes.context: relative to the function's parameters when bound
attributes.description: entity set path expression
attributes.name: EntitySetPath

attributes.description: Whether the function can be used in composition with other functions
attributes.name: IsComposable

elements.name: Term
elements.description: A term allows annotating a model element or OData resource representation with additional data.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: The termâ€™s name.
qualified type name or collection
attributes.name: Type

attributes.description: Whether the property can have null values
attributes.name: Nullable

attributes.description: primitive value
attributes.name: DefaultValue

attributes.description: qualified term name
attributes.name: BaseTerm

attributes.description: specifies a list of model elements to which the term MAY be applied to.
attributes.name: AppliesTo

elements.name: TypeDefinition
elements.description: A type definition defines a specialization of one of the primitive types.

attributes.description: The name identifier of the element
attributes.name: Name

attributes.description: qualified name of primitive type
attributes.name: UnderlyingType

elements.name: ActionImport
elements.description: Action imports allow exposing actions from an entity container. Each action import must specify the action it imports and the EntitySet or Singleton that exposes it.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: The ActionImport's name.
qualified unbound action name
attributes.name: Action

attributes.context: relative to the containing entity container
attributes.description: entity set name or target path
attributes.name: EntitySet

elements.name: EntitySet
elements.description: Entity sets are top-level collection-valued resources. An entity set is identified by its name and must specify a type that must be an entity type in scope.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: The value of Name is the entity setâ€™s name
qualified entity type name
attributes.name: EntityType

attributes.description: Whether to include this element in the service document
attributes.name: IncludeInServiceDocument

elements.name: FunctionImport
elements.description: Function imports allow exposing functions from an entity container. All unbound overloads of the imported function can be invoked from the entity container.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: The function importâ€™s name.
qualified unbound function name
attributes.name: Function

attributes.context: relative to the containing entity container
attributes.description: entity set name or target path
attributes.name: EntitySet

attributes.description: Whether to include this element in the service document
attributes.name: IncludeInServiceDocument

elements.name: Key
elements.description: An entity is uniquely identified within an entity set by its key.

elements.name: Member
elements.description: Enumeration type values consist of discrete members. Each member is identified by its name and must specify an associated numeric value.

attributes.description: The name identifier of the element
attributes.name: Name

attributes.description: integer value
attributes.name: Value

elements.name: NavigationProperty
elements.description: A navigation property allows navigation to related entities.

attributes.description: The name identifier of the element
attributes.name: Name

attributes.description: qualified entity type name or collection of that
attributes.name: Type

attributes.description: Whether the property can have null values
attributes.name: Nullable

attributes.context: relative to the target entity type specified in Type attribute
attributes.description: path to partner navigation property
attributes.name: Partner

attributes.description: Whether the navigation property contains its target entities
attributes.name: ContainsTarget

elements.name: Parameter
elements.description: An action or function overload may specify parameters. Each parameter must have a name that is a simple identifier and must specify a type.

attributes.description: The name identifier of the element
attributes.name: Name

attributes.description: qualified type name or collection
attributes.name: Type

attributes.description: Whether the property can have null values
attributes.name: Nullable

elements.name: Property
elements.description: A structural property is a property of a structured type

attributes.description: The name identifier of the element
attributes.name: Name

attributes.description: qualified type name or collection of that
attributes.name: Type

attributes.description: Whether the property can have null values
attributes.name: Nullable

attributes.description: the model's value of the attribute when the attribute is not present in CSDL
attributes.name: DefaultValue

attributes.description: specifies the maximum number of digits allowed to the right of the decimal point.
attributes.name: Scale

elements.name: ReturnType
elements.description: The return type of an action or function overload may be any type in scope, or a collection of any type in scope.

attributes.description: qualified type name or collection
attributes.name: Type

attributes.description: Whether the property can have null values
attributes.name: Nullable

elements.name: Singleton
elements.description: Singletons are top-level single-valued resources. A singleton is identified by its name and must specify a type that must be an entity type in scope.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: The value of Name is the singleton's name
qualified entity type name
attributes.name: Type

attributes.description: Whether the property can have null values
attributes.name: Nullable

elements.name: NavigationPropertyBinding
elements.description: Navigation property bindings associate a navigation property with a target entity set or singleton, allowing navigation between entity sets.

attributes.context: relative to the containing entity set's entity type
attributes.description: navigation property path expression
attributes.name: Path

attributes.context: relative to the containing entity container
attributes.description: target path to entity set/singleton
attributes.name: Target

elements.name: OnDelete
elements.description: The action the service will take on related entities when the entity on which the navigation property is defined is deleted.

attributes.description: action the service will take on related entities when the entity is deleted.
attributes.name: Action

elements.name: PropertyRef
elements.description: An entity typeâ€™s key refers to the set of properties whose values uniquely identify an instance of the entity type within an entity set.

attributes.context: relative to the containing entity type
attributes.description: path to structural property
attributes.name: Name

attributes.description: Alternative name that can be used to reference the property
attributes.name: Alias

elements.name: ReferentialConstraint
elements.description: Entity containers define the entity sets, singletons, function and action imports exposed by the service.

attributes.context: relative to the containing navigation property's source entity type
attributes.description: path to dependent property
attributes.name: Property

attributes.context: relative to the containing navigation property's target entity type
attributes.description: path to principal property
attributes.name: ReferencedProperty

elements.name: Annotation
elements.description: An annotation applies a term to a model element and defines how to calculate a value for the term application.

attributes.description: qualified term name
attributes.name: Term

attributes.description: Optional qualifier to distinguish multiple instances
attributes.name: Qualifier

basic.description: Basic Attribute are primitive like strings, booleans, numbers, ... that are just data, associated with the model element ( )
basic.name: Basic Attributes

subcategories.description: Simple name identifier following XML naming rules
subcategories.name: simple-identifier

subcategories.description: Integer value greater than or equal to zero
subcategories.name: non-negative-integer

subcategories.description: any primitive value (string, number, boolean, etc.)
subcategories.name: primitive-value

path.description: Path expressions in form of a sequence of model element names. Represented in XML/JSON as a string of element names with delimiters
path.name: Path Attributes

subcategories.description: Paths that are naming connected elements by starting from the root of the model
subcategories.name: Absolute Path

subcategories.description: Paths that are resolved relative to a specific element context
subcategories.name: Relative Path

reference.description: Reference Attributes are symbolic references to model elements. They are epresented in CSDL XML/JSON as qualified names, type names, target paths, etc.
reference.name: Reference Attributes

subcategories.description: symbolic references that reference elements anywhere in the model
subcategories.name: Absolute Reference

subcategories.description: symbolic references that reference elements relative to a specific ancestor (or related) context element
subcategories.name: Relative Reference
